disableParam_NT.Wiki: Parameters marked with are excluded in the NT version package.

sortGroupId.Wiki: Sort item type ID. In the sort Item type order, the same ID is displayed together as the same group.

itemGetTutorialFlagId.Wiki: Event flag ID for the tutorial when you first get the item. Flag ON when item is obtained.

swordArtsParamId.Wiki: ID of the destination arts parameter

rarity.Wiki: Rarity used in item acquisition logs

isDiscard.Wiki: Can you throw away the item? TRUE = thrown away

isDrop.Wiki: Can I put the item on the spot? TRUE = can be placed

isDeposit.Wiki: Can you leave it in the warehouse?

showDialogCondType.Wiki: Whether to display it in the item acquisition dialog when acquiring an item (not entered: new only)

showLogCondType.Wiki: Whether to display in the item acquisition log when acquiring the item (not entered: )

defaultWepAttr.Wiki: Default weapon attribute ID. Can be installed even with unopened weapon attributes

isSpecialSwordArt.Wiki: Determines whether this Ash of War is considered 'special'. Weapons with restrictSpecialSwordArt set to 1 will be unable to slot in these ashes of war.

canMountWep_Dagger.Wiki: Can it be attached to Weapon type: Dagger? No input becomes x

spEffectMsgId0.Wiki: Effect text ID 00 (Gem_Effect). Magic stone effect text to display in status

spEffectMsgId1.Wiki: Effect text ID 01 (Gem_Effect). Magic stone effect text to display in status

spEffectId_forAtk0.Wiki: Special effect parameter ID for attack hit

spEffectId_forAtk1.Wiki: Special effect parameter ID for attack hit

spEffectId_forAtk2.Wiki: Special effect parameter ID for attack hit

mountWepTextId.Wiki: Corresponding Weapon Type Overwrite Text ID (-1: Do not overwrite) [Menu Text]

Self.Wiki: Defines an Ash of War item. Determines what weapons it can be applied to and with what affinities.\nDoes not manage unique Ashes of War. Ashes of war may not immediately function on arbitrary weapons.
